tasks.task: Designing and operating a log hopper for forest management.
subtasks: Introduce oneself and overview of Tick Creek Ranch.
Explain the purpose and features of the log hopper.
Demonstrate the winch system and its components.
Discuss the walking beam suspension.
Show the trolley system and cradle functions.
Illustrate handling log loads and safety measures.
Demonstrate traversing obstacles with the log hopper.
Highlight customization and feedback opportunities.

tasks.task: Safety Demonstration - Handling and Swiveling the Trailer Tongue.
subtasks: Show the swiveling tongue setup.
Demonstrate safety measures during heavy load operations.
Highlight modification for increased safety and load handling.
Illustrate the process of removing a flat tire.
Show weight redistribution to maintain trailer stability.
Explain splicing the tongue for enhanced control.

tasks.task: Forest Management and Timber Harvesting with the Log Hopper.
subtasks: Discuss ecological and biological consciousness in operations.
Demonstrate log selection and preparation for transport.
Explain the use of different chain lengths and safety checks.
Show the log arch setup and cradle mechanism.
Demonstrate adjusting the log for balance and optimal towing.
Illustrate handling log variations in length and weight.
